    13‚Üí/-!
    14‚Üí# Erd≈ës Problem #500
    15‚Üí
    16‚ÜíWhat is ex‚ÇÉ(n, K‚ÇÑ¬≥)? That is, the largest number of 3-edges which can be placed
    17‚Üíon n vertices so that there exists no K‚ÇÑ¬≥, a set of 4 vertices which is covered
    18‚Üíby all 4 possible 3-edges.
    19‚Üí
    20‚ÜíA problem of Tur√°n. Tur√°n observed that dividing the vertices into three equal
    21‚Üíparts X‚ÇÅ, X‚ÇÇ, X‚ÇÉ, and taking the edges to be those triples that either have
    22‚Üíexactly one vertex in each part or two vertices in X·µ¢ and one vertex in X·µ¢‚Çä‚ÇÅ
    23‚Üí(where X‚ÇÑ = X‚ÇÅ) shows that
    24‚Üí
    25‚Üí  ex‚ÇÉ(n, K‚ÇÑ¬≥) ‚â• (5/9 + o(1)) C(n, 3).
    26‚Üí
    27‚ÜíThis is probably the truth. The current best upper bound is
    28‚Üí
    29‚Üí  ex‚ÇÉ(n, K‚ÇÑ¬≥) ‚â§ 0.5611666 C(n, 3),
    30‚Üí
    31‚Üídue to Razborov [Ra10].
    32‚Üí-/
    33‚Üí
    34‚Üí/-- A 3-uniform hypergraph on `Fin n` is K‚ÇÑ¬≥-free if every edge has exactly 3
    35‚Üí    vertices and no 4 vertices span all 4 possible 3-element subsets. -/
    36‚Üídef IsK43Free {n : ‚Ñï} (H : Finset (Finset (Fin n))) : Prop :=
    37‚Üí  (‚àÄ e ‚àà H, e.card = 3) ‚àß
    38‚Üí  ‚àÄ S : Finset (Fin n), S.card = 4 ‚Üí ¬¨(S.powersetCard 3 ‚äÜ H)
    39‚Üí
    40‚Üí/-- The 3-uniform Tur√°n number ex‚ÇÉ(n, K‚ÇÑ¬≥): the maximum number of 3-element subsets
    41‚Üí    of an n-element set such that no 4 vertices span all 4 triples. -/
    42‚Üínoncomputable def ex3K43 (n : ‚Ñï) : ‚Ñï :=
    43‚Üí  sSup {m : ‚Ñï | ‚àÉ H : Finset (Finset (Fin n)), IsK43Free H ‚àß H.card = m}
    44‚Üí
    45‚Üí/--
    46‚ÜíErd≈ës Conjecture (Problem #500) ‚Äî Tur√°n's Hypergraph Conjecture [Er61][Er71][Er74c][Er81]:
    47‚Üí
    48‚ÜíThe 3-uniform Tur√°n density for K‚ÇÑ¬≥ is exactly 5/9. Equivalently,
    49‚Üí
    50‚Üí  ex‚ÇÉ(n, K‚ÇÑ¬≥) / C(n, 3) ‚Üí 5/9 as n ‚Üí ‚àû.
    51‚Üí
    52‚ÜíTur√°n conjectured that the lower bound construction (partition into 3 equal parts,
    53‚Üítake triples with one vertex in each part or two in X·µ¢ and one in X·µ¢‚Çä‚ÇÅ) is
    54‚Üíoptimal. This remains open. The best known upper bound is ‚â§ 0.5611666 C(n, 3)
    55‚Üídue to Razborov [Ra10].
    56‚Üí-/
    57‚Üítheorem erdos_problem_500 :
    58‚Üí    Tendsto
    59‚Üí      (fun n : ‚Ñï => (ex3K43 n : ‚Ñù) / (Nat.choose n 3 : ‚Ñù))

    61‚Üí  sorry

    63‚Üíend

    10‚Üí/-- The polynomial with prescribed ¬±1 coefficients:
    11‚Üíf_n(z) = Œ£_{k=0}^{n} Œµ(k) ¬∑ z^k. -/
    12‚Üínoncomputable def signPoly (Œµ : ‚Ñï ‚Üí ‚Ñù) (n : ‚Ñï) : Polynomial ‚Ñù :=
    13‚Üí  ‚àë k ‚àà range (n + 1), C (Œµ k) * X ^ k
    14‚Üí
    15‚Üí/-- The number of distinct real roots of a real polynomial. -/
    16‚Üínoncomputable def numRealRoots (p : Polynomial ‚Ñù) : ‚Ñï :=
    17‚Üí  Set.ncard {x : ‚Ñù | p.IsRoot x}
    18‚Üí
    19‚Üí/-- A random variable is Rademacher distributed: it takes values in {-1, 1}
    20‚Üíwith equal probability (each with probability 1/2 on a probability space). -/
    21‚Üídef IsRademacher {Œ© : Type*} [MeasurableSpace Œ©] (Œº : Measure Œ©) (X : Œ© ‚Üí ‚Ñù) : Prop :=
    22‚Üí  (‚àÄ œâ, X œâ = 1 ‚à® X œâ = -1) ‚àß
    23‚Üí  Œº {œâ | X œâ = 1} = Œº {œâ | X œâ = -1}
    24‚Üí
    25‚Üí/--
    26‚ÜíErd≈ës Problem #521:
    27‚ÜíLet (Œµ_k)_{k ‚â• 0} be independently uniformly chosen at random from {-1, 1}.
    28‚ÜíIf R_n counts the number of real roots of f_n(z) = Œ£_{k=0}^{n} Œµ_k z^k,
    29‚Üíthen, almost surely, lim_{n‚Üí‚àû} R_n / log n = 2/œÄ.
    30‚Üí
    31‚ÜíErd≈ës and Offord showed that the number of real roots of a random degree n
    32‚Üípolynomial with ¬±1 coefficients is (2/œÄ + o(1)) log n in expectation.
    33‚ÜíThis conjecture asks whether the convergence holds almost surely.
    34‚Üí-/
    35‚Üítheorem erdos_problem_521
    36‚Üí    {Œ© : Type*} [MeasurableSpace Œ©] {Œº : Measure Œ©} [IsProbabilityMeasure Œº]
    37‚Üí    {Œµ : ‚Ñï ‚Üí Œ© ‚Üí ‚Ñù}
    38‚Üí    (hRad : ‚àÄ k, IsRademacher Œº (Œµ k))
    39‚Üí    (hIndep : iIndepFun Œµ Œº) :
    40‚Üí    ‚àÄ·µê œâ ‚àÇŒº, Tendsto
    41‚Üí      (fun n => (numRealRoots (signPoly (fun k => Œµ k œâ) n) : ‚Ñù) / Real.log (n : ‚Ñù))
    42‚Üí      atTop (nhds (2 / Real.pi)) :=
    43‚Üí  sorry
    44‚Üí

    43‚Üí`dist x y = 0 ‚Üî x = y`, commutativity `dist x y = dist y x`, and the triangle inequality

   109‚Üí/-- A pseudometric space is a type endowed with a `‚Ñù`-valued distance `dist` satisfying
   110‚Üíreflexivity `dist x x = 0`, commutativity `dist x y = dist y x`, and the triangle inequality

   116‚ÜíAny pseudometric space is a topological space and a uniform space (see `TopologicalSpace`,
   117‚Üí`UniformSpace`), where the topology and uniformity come from the metric.

    16‚Üídef IsFactorialRepr (n : ‚Ñï) (f : Fin n ‚Üí ‚Ñï) : Prop :=
    17‚Üí  (‚àÄ i, 0 < f i) ‚àß Monotone f ‚àß ‚àè i, f i = n.factorial
    18‚Üí
    19‚Üí/--
    20‚Üít(n) is the maximal value of the smallest factor in any representation of n!
    21‚Üías a product of n positive integers in non-decreasing order.
    22‚Üí-/
    23‚Üínoncomputable def erdos391_t (n : ‚Ñï) : ‚Ñï :=
    24‚Üí  sSup {k : ‚Ñï | ‚àÉ f : Fin n ‚Üí ‚Ñï, IsFactorialRepr n f ‚àß ‚àÄ i, k ‚â§ f i}

    28‚ÜíLet t(n) be maximal such that n! = a‚ÇÅ‚ãØa‚Çô with t(n) = a‚ÇÅ ‚â§ ‚ãØ ‚â§ a‚Çô.

    32‚Üí    Tendsto (fun n : ‚Ñï => (erdos391_t n : ‚Ñù) / (n : ‚Ñù))

    36‚Üí/--

1‚Üíimport Mathlib.Data.Finset.Basic
     2‚Üíimport Mathlib.Data.Finset.Powerset
     3‚Üíimport Mathlib.Data.Nat.Choose.Basic

     8‚Üí
     9‚Üíopen Finset Filter
    10‚Üí
    11‚Üínoncomputable section
    12‚Üí
    13‚Üí/-!
    14‚Üí# Erd≈ës Problem #500
    15‚Üí
    16‚ÜíWhat is ex‚ÇÉ(n, K‚ÇÑ¬≥)? That is, the largest number of 3-edges which can be placed
    17‚Üíon n vertices so that there exists no K‚ÇÑ¬≥, a set of 4 vertices which is covered
    18‚Üíby all 4 possible 3-edges.
    19‚Üí
    20‚ÜíA problem of Tur√°n. Tur√°n observed that dividing the vertices into three equal
    21‚Üíparts X‚ÇÅ, X‚ÇÇ, X‚ÇÉ, and taking the edges to be those triples that either have
    22‚Üíexactly one vertex in each part or two vertices in X·µ¢ and one vertex in X·µ¢‚Çä‚ÇÅ
    23‚Üí(where X‚ÇÑ = X‚ÇÅ) shows that
    24‚Üí
    25‚Üí  ex‚ÇÉ(n, K‚ÇÑ¬≥) ‚â• (5/9 + o(1)) C(n, 3).
    26‚Üí
    27‚ÜíThis is probably the truth. The current best upper bound is
    28‚Üí
    29‚Üí  ex‚ÇÉ(n, K‚ÇÑ¬≥) ‚â§ 0.5611666 C(n, 3),
    30‚Üí
    31‚Üídue to Razborov [Ra10].
    32‚Üí-/
    33‚Üí
    34‚Üí/-- A 3-uniform hypergraph on `Fin n` is K‚ÇÑ¬≥-free if every edge has exactly 3
    35‚Üí    vertices and no 4 vertices span all 4 possible 3-element subsets. -/
    36‚Üídef IsK43Free {n : ‚Ñï} (H : Finset (Finset (Fin n))) : Prop :=
    37‚Üí  (‚àÄ e ‚àà H, e.card = 3) ‚àß
    38‚Üí  ‚àÄ S : Finset (Fin n), S.card = 4 ‚Üí ¬¨(S.powersetCard 3 ‚äÜ H)
    39‚Üí
    40‚Üí/-- The 3-uniform Tur√°n number ex‚ÇÉ(n, K‚ÇÑ¬≥): the maximum number of 3-element subsets
    41‚Üí    of an n-element set such that no 4 vertices span all 4 triples. -/
    42‚Üínoncomputable def ex3K43 (n : ‚Ñï) : ‚Ñï :=
    43‚Üí  sSup {m : ‚Ñï | ‚àÉ H : Finset (Finset (Fin n)), IsK43Free H ‚àß H.card = m}
    44‚Üí
    45‚Üí/--
    46‚ÜíErd≈ës Conjecture (Problem #500) ‚Äî Tur√°n's Hypergraph Conjecture [Er61][Er71][Er74c][Er81]:
    47‚Üí
    48‚ÜíThe 3-uniform Tur√°n density for K‚ÇÑ¬≥ is exactly 5/9. Equivalently,
    49‚Üí
    50‚Üí  ex‚ÇÉ(n, K‚ÇÑ¬≥) / C(n, 3) ‚Üí 5/9 as n ‚Üí ‚àû.
    51‚Üí
    52‚ÜíTur√°n conjectured that the lower bound construction (partition into 3 equal parts,
    53‚Üítake triples with one vertex in each part or two in X·µ¢ and one in X·µ¢‚Çä‚ÇÅ) is
    54‚Üíoptimal. This remains open. The best known upper bound is ‚â§ 0.5611666 C(n, 3)
    55‚Üídue to Razborov [Ra10].
    56‚Üí-/
    57‚Üítheorem erdos_problem_500 :
    58‚Üí    Tendsto
    59‚Üí      (fun n : ‚Ñï => (ex3K43 n : ‚Ñù) / (Nat.choose n 3 : ‚Ñù))
    60‚Üí      atTop (nhds (5 / 9 : ‚Ñù)) :=
    61‚Üí  sorry
    62‚Üí
    63‚Üíend
    64‚Üí

        ‚àÄ Œ¥ > 0, ‚àÉ Œµ > 0, ‚àÄ {a b : Œ≥}, dist (f a) (f b) < Œµ ‚Üí dist a b < Œ¥ := by
  rw [isUniformEmbedding_iff_isUniformInducing, isUniformInducing_iff, uniformContinuous_iff]

/-- If a `PseudoMetricSpace` is a T‚ÇÄ space, then it is a `MetricSpace`. -/
abbrev _root_.MetricSpace.ofT0PseudoMetricSpace (Œ± : Type*) [PseudoMetricSpace Œ±] [T0Space Œ±] :
    MetricSpace Œ± where
  toPseudoMetricSpace := ‚Äπ_‚Ä∫
  eq_of_dist_eq_zero hdist := (Metric.inseparable_iff.2 hdist).eq

-- see Note [lower instance priority]
/-- A metric space induces an emetric space -/
instance (priority := 100) _root_.MetricSpace.toEMetricSpace : EMetricSpace Œ≥ :=
  .ofT0PseudoEMetricSpace Œ≥

theorem isClosed_of_pairwise_le_dist {s : Set Œ≥} {Œµ : ‚Ñù} (hŒµ : 0 < Œµ)
    (hs : s.Pairwise fun x y => Œµ ‚â§ dist x y) : IsClosed s :=
  isClosed_of_spaced_out (dist_mem_uniformity hŒµ) <| by simpa using hs

theorem isClosedEmbedding_of_pairwise_le_dist {Œ± : Type*} [TopologicalSpace Œ±] [DiscreteTopology Œ±]
    {Œµ : ‚Ñù} (hŒµ : 0 < Œµ) {f : Œ± ‚Üí Œ≥} (hf : Pairwise fun x y => Œµ ‚â§ dist (f x) (f y)) :
    IsClosedEmbedding f :=
  isClosedEmbedding_of_spaced_out (dist_mem_uniformity hŒµ) <| by simpa using hf

/-- If `f : Œ≤ ‚Üí Œ±` sends any two distinct points to points at distance at least `Œµ > 0`, then
`f` is a uniform embedding with respect to the discrete uniformity on `Œ≤`. -/
--
of the edistance to reals. -/
abbrev EMetricSpace.toMetricSpaceOfDist {Œ± : Type u} [EMetricSpace Œ±] (dist : Œ± ‚Üí Œ± ‚Üí ‚Ñù)
    (dist_nonneg : ‚àÄ x y, 0 ‚â§ dist x y) (h : ‚àÄ x y, edist x y = .ofReal (dist x y)) :
    MetricSpace Œ± :=
  letI := PseudoEMetricSpace.toPseudoMetricSpaceOfDist dist dist_nonneg h
  MetricSpace.ofT0PseudoMetricSpace _

/-- One gets a metric space from an emetric space if the edistance
is everywhere finite, by pushing the edistance to reals. We set it up so that the edist and the
uniformity are defeq in the metric space and the emetric space. -/
abbrev EMetricSpace.toMetricSpace {Œ± : Type u} [EMetricSpace Œ±] (h : ‚àÄ x y : Œ±, edist x y ‚â† ‚ä§) :
    MetricSpace Œ± :=
  EMetricSpace.toMetricSpaceOfDist (ENNReal.toReal <| edist ¬∑ ¬∑) (by simp) (by simp [h])

/-- Metric space structure pulled back by an injective function. Injectivity is necessary to
ensure that `dist x y = 0` only if `x = y`. -/
abbrev MetricSpace.induced {Œ≥ Œ≤} (f : Œ≥ ‚Üí Œ≤) (hf : Function.Injective f) (m : MetricSpace Œ≤) :
    MetricSpace Œ≥ :=
  { PseudoMetricSpace.induced f m.toPseudoMetricSpace with
    eq_of_dist_eq_zero := fun h => hf (dist_eq_zero.1 h) }

/-- Pull back a metric space structure by a uniform embedding. This is a version of
`MetricSpace.induced` useful in case if the domain already has a `UniformSpace` structure. -/

    12‚Üí/-!
    13‚Üí# Computational realization of topological spaces (experimental)
    14‚Üí
    15‚ÜíThis file provides infrastructure to compute with topological spaces.
    16‚Üí
    17‚Üí## Main declarations
    18‚Üí
    19‚Üí* `Ctop`: Realization of a topology basis.
    20‚Üí* `Ctop.Realizer`: Realization of a topological space. `Ctop` that generates the given topology.
    21‚Üí* `LocallyFinite.Realizer`: Realization of the local finiteness of an indexed family of sets.
    22‚Üí* `Compact.Realizer`: Realization of the compactness of a set.
    23‚Üí-/
    24‚Üí
    25‚Üí@[expose] public section
    26‚Üí
    27‚Üí
    28‚Üíopen Set
    29‚Üí
    30‚Üíopen Filter hiding Realizer
    31‚Üí
    32‚Üíopen Topology
    33‚Üí
    34‚Üí/-- A `Ctop Œ± œÉ` is a realization of a topology (basis) on `Œ±`,
    35‚Üí  represented by a type `œÉ` together with operations for the top element and
    36‚Üí  the intersection operation. -/
    37‚Üístructure Ctop (Œ± œÉ : Type*) where
    38‚Üí  f : œÉ ‚Üí Set Œ±
    39‚Üí  top : Œ± ‚Üí œÉ
    40‚Üí  top_mem : ‚àÄ x : Œ±, x ‚àà f (top x)

    43‚Üí  inter_sub : ‚àÄ a b x h, f (inter a b x h) ‚äÜ f a ‚à© f b
    44‚Üí
    45‚Üívariable {Œ± : Type*} {Œ≤ : Type*} {œÉ : Type*} {œÑ : Type*}
    46‚Üí
    47‚Üíinstance : Inhabited (Ctop Œ± (Set Œ±)) :=
    48‚Üí  ‚ü®{  f := id

    50‚Üí      top_mem := mem_singleton
    51‚Üí      inter := fun s t _ _ ‚Ü¶ s ‚à© t
    52‚Üí      inter_mem := fun _s _t _a ‚Ü¶ id
    53‚Üí      inter_sub := fun _s _t _a _ha ‚Ü¶ Subset.rfl }‚ü©
    54‚Üí
    55‚Üínamespace Ctop
    56‚Üí
    57‚Üísection
    58‚Üí
    59‚Üívariable (F : Ctop Œ± œÉ)
    60‚Üí
    61‚Üíinstance : CoeFun (Ctop Œ± œÉ) fun _ ‚Ü¶ œÉ ‚Üí Set Œ± :=
    62‚Üí  ‚ü®Ctop.f‚ü©
    63‚Üí
    64‚Üítheorem coe_mk (f T h‚ÇÅ I h‚ÇÇ h‚ÇÉ a) : (@Ctop.mk Œ± œÉ f T h‚ÇÅ I h‚ÇÇ h‚ÇÉ) a = f a := rfl
    65‚Üí
    66‚Üí/-- Map a Ctop to an equivalent representation type. -/
    67‚Üídef ofEquiv (E : œÉ ‚âÉ œÑ) : Ctop Œ± œÉ ‚Üí Ctop Œ± œÑ
    68‚Üí  | ‚ü®f, T, h‚ÇÅ, I, h‚ÇÇ, h‚ÇÉ‚ü© =>
    69‚Üí    { f := fun a ‚Ü¶ f (E.symm a)

    72‚Üí      inter := fun a b x h ‚Ü¶ E (I (E.symm a) (E.symm b) x h)
    73‚Üí      inter_mem := fun a b x h ‚Ü¶ by simpa using h‚ÇÇ (E.symm a) (E.symm b) x h
    74‚Üí      inter_sub := fun a b x h ‚Ü¶ by simpa using h‚ÇÉ (E.symm a) (E.symm b) x h }
    75‚Üí
    76‚Üí@[simp]

    79‚Üí
    80‚Üíend
    81‚Üí
    82‚Üí/-- Every `Ctop` is a topological space. -/
    83‚Üídef toTopsp (F : Ctop Œ± œÉ) : TopologicalSpace Œ± := TopologicalSpace.generateFrom (Set.range F.f)
    84‚Üí
    85‚Üítheorem toTopsp_isTopologicalBasis (F : Ctop Œ± œÉ) :
    86‚Üí    @TopologicalSpace.IsTopologicalBasis _ F.toTopsp (Set.range F.f) :=
    87‚Üí  letI := F.toTopsp
    88‚Üí  ‚ü®fun _u ‚ü®a, e‚ÇÅ‚ü© _v ‚ü®b, e‚ÇÇ‚ü© ‚Ü¶
    89‚Üí    e‚ÇÅ ‚ñ∏ e‚ÇÇ ‚ñ∏ fun x h ‚Ü¶ ‚ü®_, ‚ü®_, rfl‚ü©, F.inter_mem a b x h, F.inter_sub a b x h‚ü©,
    90‚Üí    eq_univ_iff_forall.2 fun x ‚Ü¶ ‚ü®_, ‚ü®_, rfl‚ü©, F.top_mem x‚ü©, rfl‚ü©
    91‚Üí
    92‚Üí@[simp]
    93‚Üítheorem mem_nhds_toTopsp (F : Ctop Œ± œÉ) {s : Set Œ±} {a : Œ±} :
    94‚Üí    s ‚àà @nhds _ F.toTopsp a ‚Üî ‚àÉ b, a ‚àà F b ‚àß F b ‚äÜ s :=
    95‚Üí  (@TopologicalSpace.IsTopologicalBasis.mem_nhds_iff _ F.toTopsp _ _ _
    96‚Üí        F.toTopsp_isTopologicalBasis).trans <|
    97‚Üí    ‚ü®fun ‚ü®_, ‚ü®x, rfl‚ü©, h‚ü© ‚Ü¶ ‚ü®x, h‚ü©, fun ‚ü®x, h‚ü© ‚Ü¶ ‚ü®_, ‚ü®x, rfl‚ü©, h‚ü©‚ü©
    98‚Üí
    99‚Üíend Ctop
   100‚Üí
   101‚Üí/-- A `Ctop` realizer for the topological space `T` is a `Ctop`
   102‚Üí  which generates `T`. -/
   103‚Üístructure Ctop.Realizer (Œ±) [T : TopologicalSpace Œ±] where
   104‚Üí  œÉ : Type*
   105‚Üí  F : Ctop Œ± œÉ
   106‚Üí  eq : F.toTopsp = T
   107‚Üí
   108‚Üíopen Ctop
   109‚Üí
   110‚Üí/-- A `Ctop` realizes the topological space it generates. -/
   111‚Üíprotected def Ctop.toRealizer (F : Ctop Œ± œÉ) : @Ctop.Realizer _ F.toTopsp :=
   112‚Üí  @Ctop.Realizer.mk _ F.toTopsp œÉ F rfl
   113‚Üí
   114‚Üíinstance (F : Ctop Œ± œÉ) : Inhabited (@Ctop.Realizer _ F.toTopsp) :=
   115‚Üí  ‚ü®F.toRealizer‚ü©
   116‚Üí
   117‚Üínamespace Ctop.Realizer
   118‚Üí
   119‚Üíprotected theorem is_basis [T : TopologicalSpace Œ±] (F : Realizer Œ±) :
   120‚Üí    TopologicalSpace.IsTopologicalBasis (Set.range F.F.f) := by
   121‚Üí  have := toTopsp_isTopologicalBasis F.F; rwa [F.eq] at this
   122‚Üí
   123‚Üíprotected theorem mem_nhds [T : TopologicalSpace Œ±] (F : Realizer Œ±) {s : Set Œ±} {a : Œ±} :
   124‚Üí    s ‚àà ùìù a ‚Üî ‚àÉ b, a ‚àà F.F b ‚àß F.F b ‚äÜ s := by
   125‚Üí  have := @mem_nhds_toTopsp _ _ F.F s a; rwa [F.eq] at this
   126‚Üí
   127‚Üítheorem isOpen_iff [TopologicalSpace Œ±] (F : Realizer Œ±) {s : Set Œ±} :
   128‚Üí    IsOpen s ‚Üî ‚àÄ a ‚àà s, ‚àÉ b, a ‚àà F.F b ‚àß F.F b ‚äÜ s :=
   129‚Üí  isOpen_iff_mem_nhds.trans <| forall‚ÇÇ_congr fun _a _h ‚Ü¶ F.mem_nhds
   130‚Üí
   131‚Üítheorem isClosed_iff [TopologicalSpace Œ±] (F : Realizer Œ±) {s : Set Œ±} :
   132‚Üí    IsClosed s ‚Üî ‚àÄ a, (‚àÄ b, a ‚àà F.F b ‚Üí ‚àÉ z, z ‚àà F.F b ‚à© s) ‚Üí a ‚àà s :=
   133‚Üí  isOpen_compl_iff.symm.trans <|
   134‚Üí    F.isOpen_iff.trans <|
   135‚Üí      forall_congr' fun a ‚Ü¶
   136‚Üí        show (a ‚àâ s ‚Üí ‚àÉ b : F.œÉ, a ‚àà F.F b ‚àß ‚àÄ z ‚àà F.F b, z ‚àâ s) ‚Üî _ by
   137‚Üí          haveI := Classical.propDecidable; rw [not_imp_comm]
   138‚Üí          simp [not_exists, not_and, not_forall, and_comm]
   139‚Üí
   140‚Üítheorem mem_interior_iff [TopologicalSpace Œ±] (F : Realizer Œ±) {s : Set Œ±} {a : Œ±} :
   141‚Üí    a ‚àà interior s ‚Üî ‚àÉ b, a ‚àà F.F b ‚àß F.F b ‚äÜ s :=
   142‚Üí  mem_interior_iff_mem_nhds.trans F.mem_nhds
   143‚Üí
   144‚Üíprotected theorem isOpen [TopologicalSpace Œ±] (F : Realizer Œ±) (s : F.œÉ) : IsOpen (F.F s) :=
   145‚Üí  isOpen_iff_nhds.2 fun a m ‚Ü¶ by simpa using F.mem_nhds.2 ‚ü®s, m, Subset.refl _‚ü©
   146‚Üí
   147‚Üítheorem ext' [T : TopologicalSpace Œ±] {œÉ : Type*} {F : Ctop Œ± œÉ}
   148‚Üí    (H : ‚àÄ a s, s ‚àà ùìù a ‚Üî ‚àÉ b, a ‚àà F b ‚àß F b ‚äÜ s) : F.toTopsp = T := by
   149‚Üí  refine TopologicalSpace.ext_nhds fun x ‚Ü¶ ?_
   150‚Üí  ext s
   151‚Üí  rw [mem_nhds_toTopsp, H]
   152‚Üí
   153‚Üítheorem ext [T : TopologicalSpace Œ±] {œÉ : Type*} {F : Ctop Œ± œÉ} (H‚ÇÅ : ‚àÄ a, IsOpen (F a))
   154‚Üí    (H‚ÇÇ : ‚àÄ a s, s ‚àà ùìù a ‚Üí ‚àÉ b, a ‚àà F b ‚àß F b ‚äÜ s) : F.toTopsp = T :=
   155‚Üí  ext' fun a s ‚Ü¶ ‚ü®H‚ÇÇ a s, fun ‚ü®_b, h‚ÇÅ, h‚ÇÇ‚ü© ‚Ü¶ mem_nhds_iff.2 ‚ü®_, h‚ÇÇ, H‚ÇÅ _, h‚ÇÅ‚ü©‚ü©
   156‚Üí
   157‚Üívariable [TopologicalSpace Œ±]
   158‚Üí
   159‚Üí/-- The topological space realizer made of the open sets. -/
   160‚Üíprotected def id : Realizer Œ± :=
   161‚Üí  ‚ü®{ x : Set Œ± // IsOpen x },

   163‚Üí      top := fun _ ‚Ü¶ ‚ü®univ, isOpen_univ‚ü©
   164‚Üí      top_mem := mem_univ
   165‚Üí      inter := fun ‚ü®_x, h‚ÇÅ‚ü© ‚ü®_y, h‚ÇÇ‚ü© _a _h‚ÇÉ ‚Ü¶ ‚ü®_, h‚ÇÅ.inter h‚ÇÇ‚ü©
   166‚Üí      inter_mem := fun ‚ü®_x, _h‚ÇÅ‚ü© ‚ü®_y, _h‚ÇÇ‚ü© _a ‚Ü¶ id
   167‚Üí      inter_sub := fun ‚ü®_x, _h‚ÇÅ‚ü© ‚ü®_y, _h‚ÇÇ‚ü© _a _h‚ÇÉ ‚Ü¶ Subset.refl _ },
   168‚Üí    ext Subtype.property fun _x _s h ‚Ü¶
   169‚Üí      let ‚ü®t, h, o, m‚ü© := mem_nhds_iff.1 h
   170‚Üí      ‚ü®‚ü®t, o‚ü©, m, h‚ü©‚ü©
   171‚Üí
   172‚Üí/-- Replace the representation type of a `Ctop` realizer. -/
   173‚Üídef ofEquiv (F : Realizer Œ±) (E : F.œÉ ‚âÉ œÑ) : Realizer Œ± :=
   174‚Üí  ‚ü®œÑ, F.F.ofEquiv E,
   175‚Üí    ext' fun a s ‚Ü¶
   176‚Üí      F.mem_nhds.trans <|
   177‚Üí        ‚ü®fun ‚ü®s, h‚ü© ‚Ü¶ ‚ü®E s, by simpa using h‚ü©, fun ‚ü®t, h‚ü© ‚Ü¶ ‚ü®E.symm t, by simpa using h‚ü©‚ü©‚ü©
   178‚Üí
   179‚Üí@[simp]
   180‚Üítheorem ofEquiv_œÉ (F : Realizer Œ±) (E : F.œÉ ‚âÉ œÑ) : (F.ofEquiv E).œÉ = œÑ := rfl
   181‚Üí
   182‚Üí@[simp]
   183‚Üítheorem ofEquiv_F (F : Realizer Œ±) (E : F.œÉ ‚âÉ œÑ) (s : œÑ) : (F.ofEquiv E).F s = F.F (E.symm s) := by
   184‚Üí  delta ofEquiv; simp
   185‚Üí
   186‚Üí/-- A realizer of the neighborhood of a point. -/
   187‚Üíprotected def nhds (F : Realizer Œ±) (a : Œ±) : (ùìù a).Realizer :=
   188‚Üí  ‚ü®{ s : F.œÉ // a ‚àà F.F s },
   189‚Üí    { f := fun s ‚Ü¶ F.F s.1
   190‚Üí      pt := ‚ü®_, F.F.top_mem a‚ü©
   191‚Üí      inf := fun ‚ü®x, h‚ÇÅ‚ü© ‚ü®y, h‚ÇÇ‚ü© ‚Ü¶ ‚ü®_, F.F.inter_mem x y a ‚ü®h‚ÇÅ, h‚ÇÇ‚ü©‚ü©
   192‚Üí      inf_le_left := fun ‚ü®x, h‚ÇÅ‚ü© ‚ü®y, h‚ÇÇ‚ü© _z h ‚Ü¶ (F.F.inter_sub x y a ‚ü®h‚ÇÅ, h‚ÇÇ‚ü© h).1
   193‚Üí      inf_le_right := fun ‚ü®x, h‚ÇÅ‚ü© ‚ü®y, h‚ÇÇ‚ü© _z h ‚Ü¶ (F.F.inter_sub x y a ‚ü®h‚ÇÅ, h‚ÇÇ‚ü© h).2 },
   194‚Üí    filter_eq <|
   195‚Üí      Set.ext fun _x ‚Ü¶
   196‚Üí        ‚ü®fun ‚ü®‚ü®_s, as‚ü©, h‚ü© ‚Ü¶ mem_nhds_iff.2 ‚ü®_, h, F.isOpen _, as‚ü©, fun h ‚Ü¶
   197‚Üí          let ‚ü®s, h, as‚ü© := F.mem_nhds.1 h
   198‚Üí          ‚ü®‚ü®s, h‚ü©, as‚ü©‚ü©‚ü©
   199‚Üí
   200‚Üí@[simp]
   201‚Üítheorem nhds_œÉ (F : Realizer Œ±) (a : Œ±) : (F.nhds a).œÉ = { s : F.œÉ // a ‚àà F.F s } := rfl
   202‚Üí
   203‚Üí@[simp]
   204‚Üítheorem nhds_F (F : Realizer Œ±) (a : Œ±) (s) : (F.nhds a).F s = F.F s.1 := rfl
   205‚Üí
   206‚Üítheorem tendsto_nhds_iff {m : Œ≤ ‚Üí Œ±} {f : Filter Œ≤} (F : f.Realizer) (R : Realizer Œ±) {a : Œ±} :
   207‚Üí    Tendsto m f (ùìù a) ‚Üî ‚àÄ t, a ‚àà R.F t ‚Üí ‚àÉ s, ‚àÄ x ‚àà F.F s, m x ‚àà R.F t :=

   209‚Üí
   210‚Üíend Ctop.Realizer
   211‚Üí
   212‚Üí/-- A `LocallyFinite.Realizer F f` is a realization that `f` is locally finite, namely it is a
   213‚Üíchoice of open sets from the basis of `F` such that they intersect only finitely many of the values
   214‚Üíof `f`. -/
   215‚Üístructure LocallyFinite.Realizer [TopologicalSpace Œ±] (F : Ctop.Realizer Œ±) (f : Œ≤ ‚Üí Set Œ±) where
   216‚Üí  bas : ‚àÄ a, { s // a ‚àà F.F s }
   217‚Üí  sets : ‚àÄ x : Œ±, Fintype { i | (f i ‚à© F.F (bas x)).Nonempty }
   218‚Üí
   219‚Üítheorem LocallyFinite.Realizer.to_locallyFinite [TopologicalSpace Œ±] {F : Ctop.Realizer Œ±}
   220‚Üí    {f : Œ≤ ‚Üí Set Œ±} (R : LocallyFinite.Realizer F f) : LocallyFinite f := fun a ‚Ü¶
   221‚Üí  ‚ü®_, F.mem_nhds.2 ‚ü®(R.bas a).1, (R.bas a).2, Subset.rfl‚ü©, have := R.sets a; Set.toFinite _‚ü©
   222‚Üí
   223‚Üítheorem locallyFinite_iff_exists_realizer [TopologicalSpace Œ±] (F : Ctop.Realizer Œ±)
   224‚Üí    {f : Œ≤ ‚Üí Set Œ±} : LocallyFinite f ‚Üî Nonempty (LocallyFinite.Realizer F f) :=
   225‚Üí  ‚ü®fun h ‚Ü¶
   226‚Üí    let ‚ü®g, h‚ÇÅ‚ü© := Classical.axiom_of_choice h

   229‚Üí        show ‚àÉ b : F.œÉ, x ‚àà F.F b ‚àß F.F b ‚äÜ g x from
   230‚Üí          let ‚ü®h, _h'‚ü© := h‚ÇÅ x
   231‚Üí          F.mem_nhds.1 h
   232‚Üí    ‚ü®‚ü®fun x ‚Ü¶ ‚ü®g‚ÇÇ x, (h‚ÇÇ x).1‚ü©, fun x ‚Ü¶
   233‚Üí        Finite.fintype <|

   235‚Üí          h'.subset fun _i hi ‚Ü¶ hi.mono (inter_subset_inter_right _ (h‚ÇÇ x).2)‚ü©‚ü©,
   236‚Üí    fun ‚ü®R‚ü© ‚Ü¶ R.to_locallyFinite‚ü©

   246‚Üí
   247‚Üíinstance [TopologicalSpace Œ±] : Inhabited (Compact.Realizer (‚àÖ : Set Œ±)) :=

   249‚Üí    suffices f = ‚ä• from absurd this h
   250‚Üí    rw [‚Üê F.eq, eq_bot_iff]
   251‚Üí    exact fun s _ ‚Ü¶ ‚ü®x, hF.trans s.empty_subset‚ü©‚ü©

    16‚Üí

    31‚Üí
    32‚Üí/-- The triangle (polygon) inequality for sequences of points; `Finset.Ico` version. -/
    33‚Üítheorem dist_le_Ico_sum_dist (f : ‚Ñï ‚Üí Œ±) {m n} (h : m ‚â§ n) :
    34‚Üí    dist (f m) (f n) ‚â§ ‚àë i ‚àà Finset.Ico m n, dist (f i) (f (i + 1)) := by
    35‚Üí  induction n, h using Nat.le_induction with
    36‚Üí  | base => rw [Finset.Ico_self, Finset.sum_empty, dist_self]
    37‚Üí  | succ n hle ihn =>
    38‚Üí    calc
    39‚Üí      dist (f m) (f (n + 1)) ‚â§ dist (f m) (f n) + dist (f n) (f (n + 1)) := dist_triangle _ _ _
    40‚Üí      _ ‚â§ (‚àë i ‚àà Finset.Ico m n, _) + _ := add_le_add ihn le_rfl
    41‚Üí      _ = ‚àë i ‚àà Finset.Ico m (n + 1), _ := by
    42‚Üí        rw [‚Üê Finset.insert_Ico_right_eq_Ico_add_one hle, Finset.sum_insert, add_comm]; simp
    43‚Üí
    44‚Üí/-- The triangle (polygon) inequality for sequences of points; `Finset.range` version. -/
    45‚Üítheorem dist_le_range_sum_dist (f : ‚Ñï ‚Üí Œ±) (n : ‚Ñï) :
    46‚Üí    dist (f 0) (f n) ‚â§ ‚àë i ‚àà Finset.range n, dist (f i) (f (i + 1)) :=
    47‚Üí  Nat.Ico_zero_eq_range ‚ñ∏ dist_le_Ico_sum_dist f (Nat.zero_le n)
    48‚Üí
    49‚Üí/-- A version of `dist_le_Ico_sum_dist` with each intermediate distance replaced
    50‚Üíwith an upper estimate. -/

     9‚Üí
    10‚Üí/-!
    11‚Üí# Metrizable Spaces
    12‚Üí
    13‚ÜíIn this file we define metrizable topological spaces, i.e., topological spaces for which there
    14‚Üíexists a metric space structure that generates the same topology.
    15‚ÜíWe define it without any reference to metric spaces in order to avoid importing the real numbers.
    16‚ÜíFor the proof that metrizable spaces admit a compatible metric,
    17‚Üísee `Mathlib/Topology/Metrizable/Uniformity.lean`.
    18‚Üí-/
    19‚Üí
    20‚Üí-- don't import the real numbers
    21‚Üíassert_not_exists AddMonoidWithOne
    22‚Üí
    23‚Üí@[expose] public section
    24‚Üí
    25‚Üíopen Filter Set Topology Uniformity UniformSpace SetRel
    26‚Üí
    27‚Üínamespace TopologicalSpace
    28‚Üí
    29‚Üívariable {Œπ X Y : Type*} {A : Œπ ‚Üí Type*} [TopologicalSpace X] [TopologicalSpace Y] [Finite Œπ]
    30‚Üí  [‚àÄ i, TopologicalSpace (A i)]
    31‚Üí
    32‚Üí/-- A topological space is *pseudometrizable* if there exists a pseudometric space structure
    33‚Üícompatible with the topology. To minimize imports, we implement this class in terms of the
    34‚Üíexistence of a countably generated uniformity inducing the topology, which is mathematically
    35‚Üíequivalent.
    36‚ÜíTo endow such a space with a compatible uniformity, use
    37‚Üí`letI : UniformSpace X := TopologicalSpace.pseudoMetrizableSpaceUniformity X`.
    38‚ÜíTo endow such a space with a compatible distance, use
    39‚Üí`letI : PseudoMetricSpace X := TopologicalSpace.pseudoMetrizableSpacePseudoMetric X`. -/
    40‚Üíclass PseudoMetrizableSpace (X : Type*) [t : TopologicalSpace X] : Prop where
    41‚Üí  exists_countably_generated :
    42‚Üí    ‚àÉ u : UniformSpace X, u.toTopologicalSpace = t ‚àß (uniformity X).IsCountablyGenerated
    43‚Üí
    44‚Üí/-- A uniform space with countably generated `ùì§ X` is pseudometrizable. -/
    45‚Üíinstance (priority := 100) _root_.UniformSpace.pseudoMetrizableSpace {X : Type*}
    46‚Üí    [u : UniformSpace X] [hu : IsCountablyGenerated (uniformity X)] : PseudoMetrizableSpace X :=
    47‚Üí  ‚ü®‚ü®u, rfl, hu‚ü©‚ü©
    48‚Üí
    49‚Üí/-- Construct on a pseudometrizable space a countably generated uniformity
    50‚Üícompatible with the topology. Use `pseudoMetrizableSpaceUniformity_countably_generated` for a proof
    51‚Üíthat this uniformity is countably generated. -/
    52‚Üí-- see note [reducible non-instances]
    53‚Üínoncomputable abbrev pseudoMetrizableSpaceUniformity (X : Type*) [TopologicalSpace X]
    54‚Üí    [h : PseudoMetrizableSpace X] : UniformSpace X :=
    55‚Üí  h.exists_countably_generated.choose.replaceTopology
    56‚Üí    h.exists_countably_generated.choose_spec.1.symm
    57‚Üí
    58‚Üíexample {X : Type*} [t : TopologicalSpace X] [PseudoMetrizableSpace X] :
    59‚Üí    (pseudoMetrizableSpaceUniformity X).toTopologicalSpace = t := by
    60‚Üí  with_reducible_and_instances rfl
    61‚Üí
    62‚Üí/-- The uniformity coming from `pseudoMetrizableSpaceUniformity` is countably generated.. -/
    63‚Üítheorem pseudoMetrizableSpaceUniformity_countably_generated
    64‚Üí    (X : Type*) [TopologicalSpace X] [h : PseudoMetrizableSpace X] :
    65‚Üí    ùì§[pseudoMetrizableSpaceUniformity X].IsCountablyGenerated :=
    66‚Üí  h.exists_countably_generated.choose_spec.2
    67‚Üí
    68‚Üíinstance pseudoMetrizableSpace_prod [PseudoMetrizableSpace X] [PseudoMetrizableSpace Y] :
    69‚Üí    PseudoMetrizableSpace (X √ó Y) :=
    70‚Üí  let : UniformSpace X := pseudoMetrizableSpaceUniformity X
    71‚Üí  have : (uniformity X).IsCountablyGenerated :=
    72‚Üí    pseudoMetrizableSpaceUniformity_countably_generated X
    73‚Üí  let : UniformSpace Y := pseudoMetrizableSpaceUniformity Y
    74‚Üí  have : (uniformity Y).IsCountablyGenerated :=
    75‚Üí    pseudoMetrizableSpaceUniformity_countably_generated Y
    76‚Üí  inferInstance
    77‚Üí
    78‚Üí/-- Given an inducing map of a topological space into a pseudometrizable space, the source space
    79‚Üíis also pseudometrizable. -/
    80‚Üítheorem _root_.Topology.IsInducing.pseudoMetrizableSpace [PseudoMetrizableSpace Y] {f : X ‚Üí Y}
    81‚Üí    (hf : IsInducing f) : PseudoMetrizableSpace X :=
    82‚Üí  let u : UniformSpace Y := pseudoMetrizableSpaceUniformity Y
    83‚Üí  have : (uniformity Y).IsCountablyGenerated :=
    84‚Üí    pseudoMetrizableSpaceUniformity_countably_generated Y
    85‚Üí  ‚ü®‚ü®u.comap f, u.toTopologicalSpace_comap.trans hf.eq_induced.symm,
    86‚Üí    Filter.comap.isCountablyGenerated (uniformity Y) (Prod.map f f)‚ü©‚ü©
    87‚Üí
    88‚Üí/-- Every pseudo-metrizable space is first countable. -/
    89‚Üíinstance (priority := 100) PseudoMetrizableSpace.firstCountableTopology
    90‚Üí    [h : PseudoMetrizableSpace X] : FirstCountableTopology X :=
    91‚Üí  let : UniformSpace X := pseudoMetrizableSpaceUniformity X
    92‚Üí  have : (uniformity X).IsCountablyGenerated :=
    93‚Üí    pseudoMetrizableSpaceUniformity_countably_generated X
    94‚Üí  inferInstance
    95‚Üí
    96‚Üíinstance PseudoMetrizableSpace.subtype [PseudoMetrizableSpace X] (s : Set X) :
    97‚Üí    PseudoMetrizableSpace s :=
    98‚Üí  IsInducing.subtypeVal.pseudoMetrizableSpace
    99‚Üí
   100‚Üíinstance pseudoMetrizableSpace_pi [‚àÄ i, PseudoMetrizableSpace (A i)] :
